backend.src.app.controllers.auth package

Submodules

backend.src.app.controllers.auth.current_user_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.auth.current_user_controller.CurrentUserController(current_user_identity_data)[source]

Bases: object

The CurrentUserController class provides methods for managing the current user on the controller level.

This class acts as a controller for retrieving and preparing data related to the current user.

Variables:

  • current_user_identity_data – The identity data of the current user.

  • current_user_service – An instance of the CurrentUserService class for performing operations related to the current user.

create_response()[source]

Prepare a response containing all data about the current user.

This method uses the current user service to retrieve all data about the current user and prepare a response.

Returns:

A response containing the current user data and a 200 status code.

Return type:

tuple[flask.Response, int]

find_user_by_identity()[source]

Find the current user by their identity data.

This method uses the current user service to retrieve the current user based on their identity data.

backend.src.app.controllers.auth.login_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.auth.login_controller.LoginController(login_data)[source]

Bases: object

The LoginController class provides methods for managing user login procedures.

This class acts as a controller for validating and preparing login response.

Variables:

  • login_data – The login data of the user.

  • login_service – An instance of the LoginService class for interacting with login procedures.

create_response()[source]

Prepare a response containing all data about the user.

This method uses the login service to prepare a response containing all data about the user.

Returns:

A response containing all data about the user, and the HTTP 200 status code.

Return type:

tuple[flask.Response, int]

validate_user()[source]

Validate the user login data.

This method uses the login service to validate the user login data. If the login data is invalid, raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the login data is invalid.

backend.src.app.controllers.auth.logout_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.auth.logout_controller.LogoutController(user_jti)[source]

Bases: object

The LogoutController class provides methods for managing logout procedures.

This class acts as a controller for handling logout operations.

Variables:

  • user_jti – The JWT token identifier (jti) of the user.

  • logout_service – An instance of the LogoutService class for managing logout operations.

create_response()[source]

Create a response indicating successful logout.

This method uses the LogoutService to prepare a response with a message indicating successful logout.

Returns:

A response containing the message and a 200 status code.

Return type:

tuple[flask.Response, int]

revoke_user_jti()[source]

Revoke the user’s JWT token.

This method uses the LogoutService to add the user’s token to the blacklist.

backend.src.app.controllers.auth.refresh_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.auth.refresh_controller.RefreshController(user_refresh_token)[source]

Bases: object

The RefreshController class provides methods for managing the refresh operation of JWT tokens.

This class acts as a controller for the refresh token operation. It validates the refresh token and prepares a response containing the new access token.

Variables:

  • user_refresh_token – The refresh token of the user.

  • refresh_service – An instance of the RefreshService class for managing the refresh operation.

create_response()[source]

Prepare a response containing the new access token.

This method uses the RefreshService to prepare a response containing the new access token.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the new access token and a 200 HTTP status code.

Return type:

tuple(dict[str, str], int)

validate_user_refresh_token()[source]

Validate the user’s refresh token.

This method uses the RefreshService to validate the refresh token. If the refresh token is invalid, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the refresh token is invalid.
